batchFermentables.notes: BEST Pilsner Malt gives beer a fresh and rounded taste. It is used for all types of beers based on basically barley malt. It forms an excellent “light” and enzyme-rich foundation for almost all beer styles. Malt characteristics: low protein levels, high extract content, light colour and high enzymatic activity.
batchFermentables.name: Pilsner

batchFermentables.notes: BEST Pale Ale deepens the light “golden” color of top-fermented beers, creating a pleasant flavor. It forms an excellent enzyme-rich foundation for intensive colored beer styles. It is an excellent base malt for brewing many different styles of British Pale Ale as well as for brewing Kölsch beer.
batchFermentables.name: Pale Ale Malt

batchFermentables.usedIn: For use in October Beer, “Bockbier”, Dark Beer, Porter, Stout, Malt Beer, “Schankbier”, Red Ale and Brown Ale amongst many other.
batchFermentables.name: Cara 120
batchFermentables.notes: Produces increased fullness, heightened malt aroma, and a full, round flavour as well as a deep, saturated colour. Use at a rate of 5-10% for dark beers and 1-5% for lighter beers.

mashFermentables.notes: BEST Pale Ale deepens the light “golden” color of top-fermented beers, creating a pleasant flavor. It forms an excellent enzyme-rich foundation for intensive colored beer styles. It is an excellent base malt for brewing many different styles of British Pale Ale as well as for brewing Kölsch beer.
mashFermentables.name: Pale Ale Malt

recipe.teaser: Just a pseudo recipe to get the brew timer started LOLZ  ;-)
recipe.name: Brouwpunt - Sinterklaas Special

hops.name: East Kent Goldings (EKG)
hops.notes: Traditional English aroma variety, smooth almost sweet ,delicate and slightly spicy. Valued for its smooth slightly spicy aroma that produces the classic Golding finish. As with Fuggles it forms the basis of many well-known and respected recipes.

Traditional English aroma variety, smooth almost sweet ,delicate and slightly spicy. Valued for its smooth slightly spicy aroma that produces the classic Golding finish. As with Fuggles it forms the basis of many well-known and respected recipes.
hops.name: East Kent Goldings (EKG)

recipe.author: Brouwpunt

yeasts.name: SafAle English Ale
yeasts.description: English ale yeast selected for its fast fermentation character and its ability to form a compact sediment at the end of fermentation, helping to improve beer clarity. Recommended for the production of a large range of ales and specially adapted to cask-conditioned ones and fermentation in cylindo-conical tanks.

batchYeasts.name: SafAle English Ale
batchYeasts.description: English ale yeast selected for its fast fermentation character and its ability to form a compact sediment at the end of fermentation, helping to improve beer clarity. Recommended for the production of a large range of ales and specially adapted to cask-conditioned ones and fermentation in cylindo-conical tanks.

batchHops.notes: Traditional English aroma variety, smooth almost sweet ,delicate and slightly spicy. Valued for its smooth slightly spicy aroma that produces the classic Golding finish. As with Fuggles it forms the basis of many well-known and respected recipes.
batchHops.name: East Kent Goldings (EKG)

boilSteps.name: 3g East Kent Goldings (EKG), 200g Sugar, Table (Sucrose), 0.13g Lallemand Servomyces
